1.text: The words of Lemuel the king, the lifting up which his mother will instruct him.

2.text: What, my son? and what the son of my womb? and what the son of my vows?

3.text: Thou shalt not give thy strength to women, and thy ways to the destroying of kings.

4.text: Not for kings, O Lemuel, not for kings to drink and for princes the desire of strong drink:

5.text: Lest he shall drink and forget what is prescribed, and change the judgment of all the sons of affliction.

6.text: Ye shall give strong drink to him perishing, and wine to the bitter of soul.

7.text: He shall drink and forget his poverty, and shall no more remember his toil.

8.text: Open thy mouth for the dumb, for the judgment of all the sons of the surviving.

9.text: Open thy mouth; judge justly, and contend for the poor and needy.

10.text: Who shall find a woman of virtue? for her price is far above pearls.

11.text: The heart of her husband trusted in her, and he shall not want spoil.

12.text: She rewarded him good and not evil all the days of her life.

13.text: She sought wool and flax, and she will work in delight with her hands.

14.text: She was as the ships of the merchant; from far off she will bring her bread.

15.text: She will rise while yet night, and she will give food to her house, and a portion to her girls.

16.text: She purposed a field, and he will take it: from the fruit of her hands she planted a vineyard.

17.text: She girded her loins with strength, and she will strengthen her arms.

18.text: She tasted that her traffic is good: her light will not go out by night.

19.text: She sent forth her hands upon the spindle, and her hands take hold of the whirl.

20.text: She spread forth her hands to the poor, and sent forth her hands to the needy.

21.text: She will not fear for her house from snow, for all her house put on double.

22.text: She made for herself coverings; byssus and purple her clothing.

23.text: Her husband was known in the gates, in his sitting with the old men of the land.

24.text: She made the under garment, and she will sell; and she gave a girdle to the Canaanite.

25.text: Strength and ornament her clothing; and she will laugh to the last day.

26.text: She opened her mouth in wisdom, and the law of mercy upon her tongue.

27.text: She viewed the goings of her house, and the bread of sloth she will not eat.

28.text: Her sons rose up and they will call her happy; her husband, and he will praise her.

29.text: Many daughters did virtue, and thou wentest up over all of them.

30.text: Favor a falsehood, and beauty vanity: a woman fearing Jehovah, she shall be praised.

31.text: Ye shall give her from the fruit of her hands, and her works shall praise her in the gates.
